item.title: How to Make a Specific Client Version Work with Your Server Rep++
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

All you have to do is add a variable with the current cache version client-sided, and on startup it checks if your current cache version is equal to that of the client’s variable. This does mean you have to re-archive your client every time you update the cache, but it is effective. You could also make a param on the webpage with the cache version, and that would work.

Read full topic

item.title: How to Make a Specific Client Version Work with Your Server Rep++
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

[quote=“mrdrzj, post:7, topic:407854”]i had made that with one of my servers idk where but in someplace you added to check for update on some thing idk lol
try ripping it off from another client and changes the details to ur server?[/quote]
Erm…what you see in this thread is the server and client that worked together that way. I’m trying to figure out how, when I update my client, to get the message that says “Download latest client”. If you need me to search for anything else, please tell me I know that this is related to the client.java in both the source and client so far

item.title: How to Make a Specific Client Version Work with Your Server Rep++
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

UID isn’t the only thing that can stop you from logging on…

This also occurs when the server is sending packets that the client doesn’t process (can’t process because in the current client they are never used).

Read full topic

item.title: How to Make a Specific Client Version Work with Your Server Rep++
item.dc:creator: @nL1 nL
item.source: How to Make a Specific Client Version Work with Your Server Rep++

item.title: How to Make a Specific Client Version Work with Your Server Rep++
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

I know this is semi-server and semi-client related, but I’ve waited quite some time for an answer on my post in the client section. Not one person responded.

Here’s the original post:

How do I make a specific version of a client only work with my server? For example, I update the cache but others may not know they need to update it. How do I make a client that will not work when I want it to not work?

Please help,

TheCyberMan

EDIT: Let me help you guys. This is in the server’s client.java:

     if(uid == 24239212) {
        returnCode = 6;
        disconnected = true;
        out.write(6);
        //misc.println(playerName+" is using the official client.");
        misc.println(playerName+" tried using the version 1 client.");
        return;
     }

This is in the client’s client.java:

        if(k == 6) {
            aString1266 = "@yel@The client has been updated.";
            aString1267 = "@yel@Please redownload it from the forums.";
        BrowserControl.displayURL("http://www.linktoforums.com/");
            return;
        }

Thank you,

TheCyberMan

Read full topic
item.source: How to Make a Specific Client Version Work with Your Server Rep++
